questions.question: What specific methodologies does the consultant utilise in their work?
What types of projects has the consultant specialised in?
What is the consultant's approach to stakeholder engagement?
What types of skills does the consultant bring to their projects?
What is the consultant's preferred communication style?
What unique value does the consultant add to their clients?

candidates.cv:
Experiential marketer --> Management consultant --> Design Thinking practitioner --> Entrepreneur.

I am engaging and energetic, described by clients as "makes things happen" and "collaborative and impactful." I balance deep analytical skills with strategic thinking, empathy and curiosity to solve problems and drive change. My approachable communication style enables me to build rapport and credibility with stakeholders quickly.

In 2020 I left corporate life to fulfil my goal of starting my own business and in April I launched Trace along with my friend Joanna.

I started my career in London at a rapidly growing company, where I was part of an entrepreneurial environment and gained experience in product development, experiential marketing and team management. I subsequently moved into strategy consulting, specialising in Financial Services projects predominantly for investment banks.

I relocated to Sydney in 2015 to pursue my career within Macquarie's internal consulting team, where I worked on projects ranging from integrating a newly acquired software company, delivering front to back operational efficiencies in energy trading and facilitating the integration of Macquarie Capital's renewable energy infrastructure assets.

I am passionate about adopting human-centred design to solve problems and identify new opportunities.  At Macquarie, I helped build the Design Thinking and Innovation capability at Macquarie through training delivery and bespoke workshops. 

In 2017 I co-founded 2026 (www.est2026.com.au), a premium fashion brand that designs lifelong, affordable handbags in the fight against fast fashion. Our products are available online but we have put marketing on hold while we focus on Trace.

Skills: Partnerships, Go to market, financial management, fundraising, business strategy, Design Thinking, data analysis, implementation, stakeholder management, workshop facilitation, programme / project management, customer services, experiential marketing.

Over 20 years in-depth experience in designing and developing End-to-End monitoring solutions. With a full comprehensive knowledge and experience of supporting and monitoring high availability e-commerce systems, online payment systems and banking applications.  

Product lead & SME for the design and implementation of Dynatrace for Lloyds Banking Group to monitor the critical payment and business applications.

Created and established the Operations Support team for Harrods.com.

Introduced both the ITIL and the DevOps framework to Harrods E-commerce Operations Team. 

Successfully implemented Akamai CDN to Harrods.com to achieve greater international presence.

Implemented monitoring tools Gomez and Dynatrace AppMon for Harrods.com 

Key stakeholder and vendor management skills from both development projects and operations.

Responsible for PCI-DSS and DPA compliance.

Lead Designer for John Lewis, designing their new call centre website. Designed to enable call centre agents to quickly take customer orders over the phone, reduce the time for training and improve the rate of cross sales and up sales

Implemented Card Authentication for John Lewis. This high level project required complex business planning to ensure that the customer checkout experience was not compromised.
